snippet: Californians today overwhelmingly banned gay marriage, cracked down on juvenile crime and rejected an overhaul of campaign financing.    Those measures were just some of the 20 social, political and pocketbook proposals on the California ballot. V...
lead_paragraph: Californians today overwhelmingly banned gay marriage, cracked down on juvenile crime and rejected an overhaul of campaign financing. Those measures were just some of the 20 social, political and pocketbook proposals on the California ballot. Voters also reaffirmed their support for casino gambling on Indian land and rejected an effort to repeal the tobacco taxes championed by a film director, Rob Reiner.
abstract: Californians overwhelmingly ban gay marriage, crack down on juvenile crime and reject overhaul of campaign financing; voters also reaffirm their support for casino gambling on Indian land and reject effort to repeal tobacco taxes championed by film dir Rob Reiner; these measures are just some of 20 social and political proposals on ballot (M)

headline.main: Californians Reject Gay Marriage and Back Tough Juvenile-Crime Laws
